Package net.happybrackets.device.sensors

Class Sensor

java.lang.Object
net.happybrackets.device.sensors.Sensor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Accelerometer, AccelerometerSimulator, Gyroscope, GyroscopeSimulator, HTS221, LPS25H, LSM6DS33, LSM9DS1, Magnetometer, MagnetometerSimulator, MiniMU
public abstract class Sensor
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract base class for types of things that are sensors. Enables adding and removing of sensor listeners, and getting sensor name. See a real Sensor implementation such as MiniMU for more details. Created by ollie on 1/06/2016.

  • Field Details

    • validLoad

      protected boolean validLoad
      Add a validLoad flag. Every sensor will need to set it when it determines that the load is valid

      protected static boolean simulatedOnly

  • Method Details

    • isSimulatedOnly

      public static boolean isSimulatedOnly()
      Flag to indicate this is just a simulator
      Returns:
      true if only a simulator

    • scaleValue

      public static float scaleValue​(double sensor_min, double sensor_max, double scaled_min, double scaled_max, double sensor_value)
      Return a scaled value for a sensor based on known maximum and minimum values A continuous function that satisfies this the following sensor_value(sensor_min) = scaled_min sensor_value(sensor_max) = scaled_max
      Parameters:
      sensor_min - the minimum value sensor would normally return
      sensor_max - the maximum value our sensor would normally return
      scaled_min - the value we want returned as our minimum for sensor minimum value
      scaled_max - the value we want returned as our maximum for our sensor maximum value
      sensor_value - the actual value of the sensor
      Returns:
      our scaled value

    • setSimulatedOnly

      public static void setSimulatedOnly​(boolean simulated)
      Set from inside IDE to indicate we are just simulating a sensor
      Parameters:
      simulated - set to true if we are simulating

    • getSensorName

      public abstract java.lang.String getSensorName()
      Returns the sensor name, typically the make/model of the hardware sensor that this class refers to.
      Returns:
      a String representing the sensor's name.

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(SensorUpdateListener listener)
      Add a @SensorUpdateListener that will listen to this @Sensor. Will be deprecated in 3.0
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add. deprecated use (@link addValueChangedListener) instead

    • addNonResettableListener

      public void addNonResettableListener​(SensorUpdateListener listener)
      Add a @SensorUpdateListener that will listen to this @Sensor. Will be deprecated in 3.0 These listeners are not removed when device is reset
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add. deprecated use (@link addValueChangedListener) instead

    • isValidLoadedSensor

      public boolean isValidLoadedSensor()
      returns true if the sensor was loaded correctly.
      Returns:
      true if sensor was loaded correctly

    • setValidLoad

      protected void setValidLoad​(boolean valid)
      This needs to be set inside sensor to indicate it had a valid load
      Parameters:
      valid - set to true if loaded

    • addValueChangedListener

      public void addValueChangedListener​(SensorValueChangedListener listener)
      Add a @SensorValueChangedListener that will listen to this @Sensor.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add.

    • addNonResettableValueChangedListener

      public void addNonResettableValueChangedListener​(SensorValueChangedListener listener)
      Add a @SensorValueChangedListener that will listen to this @Sensor. These listeners are NOT removed when device is reset
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener​(SensorUpdateListener listener)
      Remove the given @SensorUpdateListener.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to remove.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener​(SensorValueChangedListener listener)
      Remove the given @SensorValueChangedListener.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to remove.

    • clearListeners

      public void clearListeners()
      Clear all listeners listening to this @Sensor.

    • notifyListeners

      protected void notifyListeners()
      Notify all listeners that the sensor has updated

    • resetToDefault

      public void resetToDefault()
      Override this function on any sensors that have resolution or the likes set

    • reloadSimulation

      public void reloadSimulation()
      Override this on any classes you need to do something as a simulated sensor

    • roundValue

      protected double roundValue​(double val, int rounding)
      Round the double value to the number of decimal places defined by rounding If rounding is less than zero, we will leave value as is
      Parameters:
      val - the value to round
      rounding - the number of decimal places to round to
      Returns:
      the new rounded value

    • getSensor

      public static Sensor getSensor​(java.lang.Class sensorClass)
      Return a sensor if it has been constructed.
      Parameters:
      sensorClass - the class we are looking for
      Returns:
      The class if it has been stored, otherwise null

    • storeSensor

      protected static void storeSensor​(Sensor sensor)
      Store the sensor into our loadedSensors
      Parameters:
      sensor - the sensor we are loading
